Package org.mvplugins.multiverse.core.utils.position

Interface PositionNumber

All Known Implementing Classes:
PositionNumber.Absolute, PositionNumber.Relative
@AvailableSince("5.3") public sealed interface PositionNumber permits PositionNumber.Relative, PositionNumber.Absolute
Represents a number that can be either absolute or relative (prefixed with '~').
Since:
5.3

  • Method Details

    • ofAbsolute

      @AvailableSince("5.3") static PositionNumber ofAbsolute(double value)
      Creates an absolute PositionNumber. Absolute numbers represent fixed coordinates that will not be adjusted based on any base value.
      Parameters:
      value - the absolute value
      Returns:
      a PositionNumber representing the absolute value
      Since:
      5.3

    • ofRelative

      @AvailableSince("5.3") static PositionNumber ofRelative(double value)
      Creates a relative PositionNumber. Relative numbers are prefixed with '~' and represent an offset from a base value. For example, a relative PositionNumber of '~5' means 5 units more than the base value, while '~ -3' means 3 units less than the base value.
      Parameters:
      value - the relative offset value
      Returns:
      a PositionNumber representing the relative offset
      Since:
      5.3

    • fromString

      @AvailableSince("5.3") static PositionNumber fromString(String string) throws PositionParseException
      Parses a PositionNumber from a string. The string can represent either an absolute number (e.g., "10.5") or a relative number prefixed with '~' (e.g., "~5" or "~ -3"). If the string is "~" with no number, it is treated as a relative value of 0.
      Parameters:
      string - the string to parse
      Returns:
      a PositionNumber representing the parsed value.
      Throws:
      PositionParseException - If the string format is invalid.
      Since:
      5.3

    • getValue

      @AvailableSince("5.3") double getValue(double base)
      Calculates the effective value based on the base value. For absolute PositionNumbers, this returns the stored value. For relative PositionNumbers, this returns base + stored value.
      Parameters:
      base - the base value to use for relative calculations
      Returns:
      the calculated effective value
      Since:
      5.3

    • isRelative

      @AvailableSince("5.3") boolean isRelative()
      Checks if this PositionNumber is relative.
      Returns:
      true if this is a relative PositionNumber, false if absolute
      Since:
      5.3

    • isAbsolute

      @AvailableSince("5.3") boolean isAbsolute()
      Checks if this PositionNumber is absolute.
      Returns:
      true if this is an absolute PositionNumber, false if relative
      Since:
      5.3

    • getRawValue

      @AvailableSince("5.3") double getRawValue()
      Gets the raw stored value without any base adjustment.
      Returns:
      the raw value (for relative, this is the offset; for absolute, this is the fixed value)
      Since:
      5.3
